column5: Well, I finally figured out how to post pics again, so here goes.  I was out on the ice for the Tyler Charity Ice Tourney last weekend. It was nice to see so many familiar faces again. Always a great time. I had to scoot early, so I missed the festivities on shore.  Unfortunately, the fish didn't co-operate for me, except for about a dozen perch. Strange to see so many perch hauled up from 75-80 ft. depths. I tossed back the first one, thinking it was a fluke. Then came the flurry, including a few double hook sets.   The monsters of the deep.    Big Chev 4x4 & Lady Walleye discussing strategy.    Gerritt hard at work. Double hook set perch for him too. I think he landed a whitefish after I left.    How big was it Shelley?    DouG was trying to convince Percy's relatives to make the ultimate sacrifice for a good cause.    My uncle Rick and cousin Andy made it out to join the fun too.    Sunrise. Looking across the lake from tourney headquarters at Innisfil Park.
Great stuff Remo!! Good to see ya again as well !
You were pulling 'em up pretty good over there...It was great to meet you...
Good pics looks like a great day!
